org.bbi.linuxjoy

Class NoJoy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bbi.linuxjoy.LinuxJoystick
      • org.bbi.linuxjoy.NoJoy

  • public class NoJoy
extends LinuxJoystick
    NoJoy is a native implementation interface for LinuxJoystick. This interface can be used for other platforms other than Linux via JNI native library. The library name is "njnative" (njnative.dll in Windows and libnjnative.so in *nixes)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.bbi.linuxjoy.LinuxJoystick

    • Constructor Detail

      • NoJoy

        public NoJoy(int index)
        All native joysticks are identified by a numerical ID. The path string will be parsed on open
        Parameters:
        index - Numerical ID of the device

    • Method Detail

      • setNativeProperty

        public static byte[] setNativeProperty(int index,
                       int key,
                       int val)
        Set a native property for the library. This is a very non-portable function that should only be used for troubleshooting.
        Parameters:
        index - Library-defined index
        key - Library-defined property key
        val - Library-defined property value
        Returns:
        the native function may return a byte array

      • getVersionString

        public static java.lang.String getVersionString()
        Get a version information from the native library. Use this function to check for dynamic linking as this function should not change the state of the library data structures.

      • getEnumeration

        public static int[] getEnumeration()
        Enumerate native devices. The native library MUST return an array of informative 32-bit data. Follow JoyFactory enumeration format.
        Returns:
        JoyFactory enumeration format native joystick info

      • getLinkErrorString

        public static java.lang.String getLinkErrorString()
        Get the stack trace of the link error if it has occured.
        Returns:
        Stack trace for the link error as string

      • channelOpen

        protected boolean channelOpen()
        Description copied from class: LinuxJoystick
        The channel open routine. By default, the channel is implemented as a FileChannel. Override this function if other data input type is needed.
        Overrides:
        channelOpen in class LinuxJoystick
        Returns:
        True if open is successful, false otherwise

      • channelRead

        protected int channelRead()
        Description copied from class: LinuxJoystick
        The channel read routine. This defaults to reading from a file. This function can be overridden if other channel types are desired.
        Overrides:
        channelRead in class LinuxJoystick
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read

      • channelClose

        public void channelClose()
        Description copied from class: LinuxJoystick
        The channel close routine. Override this function if other input type is needed and it is not a channel
        Overrides:
        channelClose in class LinuxJoystick
